description: Create a dataset by uploading a file. See ['Dataset Creation'](https://docs.cohere.com/docs/datasets#dataset-creation) for more information.

parameters.description: The name of the uploaded dataset.
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: The dataset type, which is used to validate the data. The only valid type is `embed-input` used in conjunction with the Embed Jobs API.
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: Indicates if the original file should be stored.
parameters.name: keep_original_file

parameters.description: Indicates whether rows with malformed input should be dropped (instead of failing the validation check). Dropped rows will be returned in the warnings field.
parameters.name: skip_malformed_input

parameters.description: List of names of fields that will be persisted in the Dataset. By default the Dataset will retain only the required fields indicated in the [schema for the corresponding Dataset type](https://docs.cohere.com/docs/datasets#dataset-types). For example, datasets of type `embed-input` will drop all fields other than the required `text` field. If any of the fields in `keep_fields` are missing from the uploaded file, Dataset validation will fail.
parameters.name: keep_fields

parameters.description: List of names of fields that will be persisted in the Dataset. By default the Dataset will retain only the required fields indicated in the [schema for the corresponding Dataset type](https://docs.cohere.com/docs/datasets#dataset-types). For example, Datasets of type `embed-input` will drop all fields other than the required `text` field. If any of the fields in `optional_fields` are missing from the uploaded file, Dataset validation will pass.
parameters.name: optional_fields

parameters.description: Raw .txt uploads will be split into entries using the text_separator value.
parameters.name: text_separator

eval_data.description: An optional evaluation file to upload

RequestSource.description: The name of the project that is making the request.
RequestSource.name: X-Client-Name

BadRequest.description:
This error is returned when the request is not well formed. This could be because:
  - JSON is invalid
  - The request is missing required fields
  - The request contains an invalid combination of fields

Unauthorized.description:
This error indicates that the operation attempted to be performed is not allowed. This could be because:
  - The api token is invalid
  - The user does not have the necessary permissions

Forbidden.description:
This error indicates that the operation attempted to be performed is not allowed. This could be because:
  - The api token is invalid
  - The user does not have the necessary permissions

NotFound.description:
This error is returned when a resource is not found. This could be because:
  - The endpoint does not exist
  - The resource does not exist eg model id, dataset id

UnprocessableEntity.description:
This error is returned when the request is not well formed. This could be because:
  - JSON is invalid
  - The request is missing required fields
  - The request contains an invalid combination of fields

InvalidToken.description: This error is returned when a request or response contains a deny-listed token.

RequestCancelled.description: This error is returned when a request is cancelled by the user.

InternalServerError.description: This error is returned when an uncategorised internal server error occurs.

NotImplemented.description: This error is returned when the requested feature is not implemented.

ServiceUnavailable.description:
This error is returned when the service is unavailable. This could be due to:
  - Too many users trying to access the service at the same time

GatewayTimeout.description:
This error is returned when a request to the server times out. This could be due to:
  - An internal services taking too long to respond
